security: Disclosing that Trial Stratton is gathering information on Court Wood and his associates could compromise Stratton's ability to collect intelligence in the future. Revealing the specific publications Stratton observed in Wood's apartment could expose intelligence-gathering methods.
summary: Trial Stratton reports on his interactions with Court Wood, a leftist interested in supporting Castro's Cuba, and his plans to illegally enter Cuba.
summary_one_paragraph: On March 18, 1961, Trial Stratton, WH/4/Security, reports to Mr. Jack Kennedy that he spent hours with Court Wood discussing Wood's plans and participation in the FRAY FOR CUBA COMITEE. Stratton believes Wood is naive about his position with the Agency but is forthcoming with information. Stratton observed Communist publications in Wood's apartment and notes Wood's extreme leftist views and desire to become a terrorist for the Castro government, planning to illegally enter Cuba with members of the "26th of July Movement". Stratton hopes to gather more names and facts about these plans.
title: Report on Court Wood's Activities and Plans
